main event: A military aircraft pilot sighted a bright object moving across the horizon at high velocity near Parkersburg, West Virginia on October 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was sighted for approximately 30 seconds as it moved from northwest to southeast.
The object appeared to be moving at very high speed and disappeared from sight.
The object was first sighted in the four-thirty to five o'clock position in relation to the aircraft, which was flying on a heading of 200 degrees.
The sighting was reported by the pilot to the Jackson, Michigan radio facility.
The report concluded the object was possibly a satellite, aircraft, astronomical, or manmade.
